subject: Law
title: Environmental Racism and Siting Disputes
description: A fast breakdown of Environmental Racism and Siting Disputes for builders.

hook.text: A landfill, a refinery, and a chemical plantâ€”all in the same Black neighborhood. Coincidence? The data says no.

buildup.text: Environmental racism describes the disproportionate placement of pollution sources near minority communities.

discovery.text: Title VI of the Civil Rights Act bars discrimination in federally funded programs. It applies to EPA-funded permits.

twist.text: Proving intentional discrimination is hard. Disparate impact claims under Title VI have had limited court success.

climax.text: Communities are using state laws and local activism to block new polluting facilities in overburdened neighborhoods.

punchline.text: Where pollution lands isn't random. The law is starting to acknowledge that.

quiz.question: What federal law can be used to challenge environmental racism?
options: Title VI of the Civil Rights Act
